concept.title: Merging Streams
concept.shortdesc: You can merge streams of data in a pipeline by connecting two or more stages to the same downstream stage. When you merge streams of data, the channels the data from all streams to the same stage, but does not perform a join of records in the stream.

conbody.p: For example, in the following pipeline, Routes Data sends data with null values to Replaces Null Values. The data from stream 2 of Routes Data and all data from Replaces Null Values both pass to Field-Level Expressions for further processing, but in no particular order and with no record merging.
conbody.note: The pipeline validation does not prevent duplicate data. To avoid writing duplicate data to destinations, configure pipeline logic to remove duplicate data or to prevent the generation of duplicate data.
